title: Grab this Deal on the OnePlus Nord N30 Before the Year Ends!
description: End the year with this awesome deal! The post Grab this Deal on the OnePlus Nord N30 Before the Year Ends! appeared first on Phandroid.
author: Mike Viray
excerpt: End the year with this awesome deal!
text: If you’re after a relatively-affordable smartphone without spending too much, then you might want to check out what OnePlus offers with its Nord line of phones, which is relatively more affordable versus its flagship line. With that in mind, the OnePlus Nord N30 5G is certainly a tempting offer at the moment, with up to 70 bucks off from its usual retail price. While the N30 is an entry-level device, it does pack a decent set of features for the a relatively low price tag. The phone comes with a large 6.7-inch display with a smooth 120Hz refresh rate which makes it ideal for web browsing, movie streaming and games, a 108-megapixel main camera with additional sensors, a large 5,000 mAh battery with 50W fast-charging support, and Qualcomm’s Snapdragon 695 chipset. You can grab the phone using the link below. Note: this article may contain affiliate links that help support our authors and keep the Phandroid servers running. A writer and content creator with a love for tech and music, Mike is also an avid gamer as well. He and his wife are big fans of Mario Kart. If you’re after a relatively-affordable smartphone without spending too much, then you might want to check out what OnePlus offers with its Nord line of phones, which is relatively more affordable versus its flagship line. With that in mind, the OnePlus Nord N30 5G is certainly a tempting offer at the moment, with up to 70 bucks off from its usual retail price.

While the N30 is an entry-level device, it does pack a decent set of features for the a relatively low price tag. The phone comes with a large 6.7-inch display with a smooth 120Hz refresh rate which makes it ideal for web browsing, movie streaming and games, a 108-megapixel main camera with additional sensors, a large 5,000 mAh battery with 50W fast-charging support, and Qualcomm’s Snapdragon 695 chipset.
